LanguageData.Cobra.label: cobra
LanguageData.Cobra.description: A large predatory snake. Cobras can be highly aggressive if provoked, and their bite injects toxic venom into the victim.
LanguageData.Cobra.tools.0.label: venom-fangs
LanguageData.Cobra.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.Cobra_Leather.label: cobra leather
LanguageData.Cobra_Corpse.label: cobra corpse
LanguageData.Monkey.label: monkey
LanguageData.Monkey.description: A small primate, the monkey can use its curly tail to grab on to branches, leaving its hands free to do other things. Monkeys are selfish but clever, and can be trained to carry out fairly complex tasks.
LanguageData.Monkey.tools.0.label: left fist
LanguageData.Monkey.tools.1.label: right fist
LanguageData.Monkey.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Monkey_Leather.label: monkey leather
LanguageData.Monkey_Corpse.label: monkey corpse
LanguageData.Boomalope.label: boomalope
LanguageData.Boomalope.description: Engineered for chemicals production, the boomalope grows a large sac of volatile chemicals on its back. Though it is weak and fragile for its size, other animals have learned to avoid it because of the huge explosion it produces when it dies. It can be milked to produce chemfuel - very carefully.
LanguageData.Boomalope.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.Boomalope_Leather.label: boomalope leather
LanguageData.Boomalope_Corpse.label: boomalope corpse
LanguageData.Lacosdile.label: lacosdile
LanguageData.Lacosdile.description: A lacosdile is a crossbred and genetically manipulated lizard originally created as part of clever fragrance marketing gig. Being herbivorous and barely dangerous made them very common pets. However as the trends passed lacosdiles were soon found flooding the sewage systems, and in desperation were carried off across the galaxy to the furthest reaches of space. As a result the species now flourish on desolate rimworlds, where they have adapted to become omnivorous.
LanguageData.Lacosdile.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Lacosdile.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Lacosdile.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Lacosdile_Leather.label: lacosdile leather
LanguageData.Lacosdile_Corpse.label: lacosdile corpse
LanguageData.Okapi.label: okapi
LanguageData.Okapi.description: A giraffid artiodactyl mammal. Okapis are primarily diurnal but may be active for a few hours in darkness. They are essentially solitary, coming together only to breed. Okapis are herbivores, feeding on tree leaves and buds, grasses, ferns, fruits, and fungi. Okapis inhabit canopy forests at altitudes of 500–1,500 m (1,600–4,900 ft).
LanguageData.Okapi.tools.0.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Okapi.tools.1.label: right hoof
LanguageData.Okapi.tools.2.label: teeth
LanguageData.Okapi.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Okapi_Leather.label: okapi leather
LanguageData.Okapi_Corpse.label: okapi corpse
